alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 19 at 1:52PM MST until February 22 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Potential total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches across the lower elevations, with one to two feet in the mountains, including Casper Mountain. Northeast wind frequently gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central Wyoming. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible as the snow and wind combine to create reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Local snow amounts up to 15 inches around the south side of Casper and the foothills south of Lander.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. This storm has the potential to create widespread travel impacts.
